title: Angular velocity of bar as a function of time

content.description: The bar shown above is pivoted about one end and is initially at rest in a vertical position. The bar is displaced slightly and as it falls it makes an angle ùúΩ with the vertical at any given time, as shown above.
content.question: Which of the following graphs best represents the bar‚Äôs angular velocity œâ as a function of time?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with omega on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis. Choice A is a line that starts at the origin and increases linearly.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with omega on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis. Choice B is a line that starts at a point on the vertical axis above the origin and decreases linearly, ending on the horizontal axis.
Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with omega on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis.  Choice C is a curve that starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with omega on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis. Choice D is a curve that starts at a point on the vertical axis above the origin and is decreasing and concave down, ending on the horizontal axis.
Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with omega on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis. Choice E is a curve that starts at the origin and is increasing and concave up.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with omega on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis. Choice E is a curve that starts at the origin and is increasing and concave up.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
